metadata.titel_preek: Third Sermon: The New Family at the Cross

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: In the 'hour' of his death, Jesus creates a new ontological reality (the Church) by reconfiguring human relationships from blood-kinship to spiritual-kinship.

tekstueel_bewijs: He is giving two unrelated believers to one another
The organic connection that Jesus creates
A new family is brought into being
The love of the Father and the Son for each other
Holy Father, keep them in thy name

ontvanger.identificatie: The Disciples (Mary, the Beloved Disciple, and the Hearers)
tekstueel_bewijs: He is giving you to me and me to you
You are loved by our Lord
ontvanger.positie_hoorder: The hearer identifies as the Receiver of a new identity.

helper.identificatie: The Holy Spirit (implied via the Word) and the Sacramental life
helper.rol_van_god: God is the Subject, not merely a Helper.
helper.rol_van_geest: Indwelling power that enables the 'love for one another'.

tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: Individualism is treated not as a minor flaw but as a structural barrier to the very nature of Christ's work.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The disciples practicing the love they have received within the community.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer/The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is explicitly rooted in the primary program (Christ's creation of the family).

voorbeelden_god_subject: Jesus turns his failing eyesight down...
He gives his mother to him...
The Lord's passion is about to begin.
voorbeelden_mens_subject: We Americans tend to be a sentimental people.
The beloved disciple takes the mother of Jesus to his own home.

voorbeelden: A new commandment I give to you
Sir, we wish to see Jesus
Many of us don’t understand what is happening
The love of Christ which overcomes the sin

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon focuses on the 'Power' (Pouvoir) of Christ to create a new reality that humans cannot create themselves.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: From S2 (Individualism) through ~S1 (Sentimentalism) to S1 (Communion) via the Cross.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: The tension is resolved by Christ's 'Hour' which forcibly reconciles the fragmented world.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High; isolation is seen as a denial of the Gospel.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: The sermon is deeply theocentric. The creation of the church is an act of Christ, not a human achievement or a social club.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: She is learning to be his disciple.

indicatoren_genade.indicator: Christ as the sole Actor of the New Creation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: She is his new creation, by water and the Word.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Mary is used not as a moral hero to imitate, but as a representative of the new status Christ confers.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: The sermon already provides a theocentric reading: Mary is a 'Receiver' of a new home/identity.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Relief from the burden of self-creation; sense of belonging.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Ecclesiology is a subset of Soteriology.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The transition from the historical cross to the contemporary church is seamless through the concept of 'The Hour'.
spanning_punten: The tension between the 'sinful church' and the 'Body of Christ'.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: I am the vine, you are the branches.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment of the ability to love.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Sin is seen as the 'breaking of hearts' and the 'degradation' of the cross.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The narrative engine is driven by Christ's action on the cross. The hearer is placed in the role of the 'Beloved Disciple' who receives a mother/community.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Pouvoir (Power), which is appropriate for Good Friday.

tegenstander_intensivering.huidige_status: Individualism is named but could be more sharply contrasted with the 'powers' of death.
tegenstander_intensivering.voorgestelde_intensivering: Connect American individualism more explicitly to the 'shame and degradation' of the cross.
tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: To show that individualism is a form of death that only Christ's death can kill.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This sermon is a masterclass in theocentric preaching, successfully moving the hearer from the 'Subject' of their own life to a 'Receiver' in Christ's new family.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While a rhetorical analysis would focus on the use of the Frank Stella anecdote, semiotics shows that Stella functions as a 'Helper' to define the Object (losing identity).
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis explains the Greek 'Woman'; semiotics explains why Jesus calling her 'Woman' changes the Actantial Subject from 'Son' to 'Lord'.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that the 'Church' is not just a topic but the 'Object of Value' that Christ (Subject) wins from the Opponent (Individualism/Death).

appendices.notities: The sermon effectively uses the 'Axis of Transmission' to pass the value of the 'New Family' from the Cross to the Fifth Avenue context.
